contentrichtext.text: {{one source|date=February 2010}} {{Infobox radio station | image = | name = CJKL-FM| airdate = 1934| frequency = 101.5 [[MHz]] ([[FM radio|FM]])| city = [[Kirkland Lake]], [[Ontario]]| format = [[hot adult contemporary]]| owner = Connelly Communications| sister_stations = [[CJTT-FM]] | erp = 23 kW| branding = | slogan = | class = B| webcast = http://rs3.radiostreamer.com:8210/listen.pls | website = [http://www.cjklfm.com/ CJKL-FM]| callsign_meaning = | }} '''CJKL-FM 101.5''' is an FM [[radio station]] in [[Kirkland Lake]], [[Ontario]]. The station is owned by Connelly Communications Corporation, which also owns [[CJTT-FM]] in [[Temiskaming Shores]]. Connelly Communications is owned by Rob Connelly of Kirkland Lake. The station offers a hot adult contemporary format with a mix of current music and classic hits. Hourly news and sports is provided through local announcers/reporters and [[Canadian Press|Broadcast News / Canadian Press]]. A live online feed is available on the station's website. ==History== CJKL first went on the air in 1934 on its original [[AM radio|AM]] frequency at 1310 kHz as part of the Thomson media empire owned by [[Roy Thomson, 1st Baron Thomson of Fleet|Roy Thomson]]. In 1939, CJKL moved from 1310 to 560 kHz. In 1985, Connelly purchased CJKL and CJTT from Bob Ancell.<ref>[http://www.crtc.gc.ca/eng/archive/1985/DB85-462.HTM Decision CRTC 85-462]</ref> In 1999, after 65 years on the AM dial, the station flipped from 560 AM to its current frequency at 101.5 FM.<ref>[http://www.crtc.gc.ca/eng/archive/1999/DB99-181.HTM Decision CRTC 99-181]</ref> Billionaire [[Jack Kent Cooke]] managed the station in the late 1930s & early 1940s for Thomson. CJKL broadcast one of the first radio [[call-in]] [[talk show]]s in Canada, which debuted in 1953 hosted by Anita Ross Thompson.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bpwgreatersudbury.com/woman-of-the-month-2/women-of-interest/anita-ross-thompson|title=Anita Ross Thompson|publisher=[[Business and Professional Women Greater Sudbury]]|accessdate=2012-03-07|date=2009-12-30}}</ref> ==Special Programming== Mystic Lounge: Fridays 7pm-Midnight (5 decades of Music) Bob Kingsley's Country Top 40 Countdown: Saturdays 8am-Noon (Country Music Countdown) American Top 40 with Ryan Seacrest: Saturdays Noon-4 pm (Pop Music Countdown) Saturday Night Rocks: Saturdays 4pm-Midnight (Classic Rock) Sunday Morning Olides: Sundays 8am-Noon (50's, 60's & 70's music) ==CJKL Citizen of the Year Award== Since 1988, CJKL has presented this annual award to honour local citizens, groups and organizations who have contributed to improving the quality of life for the people of [[Kirkland Lake]]. In addition, the station also presents the CJKL Lifetime Achievement award recognizing a lifetime of contribution to the community. ==CJKL Carnival Queen Pageant== Since 1989, the station has hosted the annual CJKL Carnival Queen Pageant. 16 contestants take part in events throughout January and February leading up to the crowning & fashion show at the [[Northern College (Ontario)|Northern College]] auditorium during Kirkland Lake's Winter Carnival. ==CJKL Christmas Wish== For more than 26 years CJKL has hosted the Christmas Wish program for less fortunate children in the Kirkland Lake area. Through several fundraisers and the contributions of local families, groups & businesses, the program provides new clothing and toys for over 250 children each year. ==Merchant Mania Home Show== CJKL hosts Kirkland Lake's annual home show on [[Mother's Day]] weekend on the floor of the community complex. The event draws over 5,000 people each year for a 2-day sale featuring local merchants and retailers from Canada & the United States. ==Spooktacular== CJKL FM's Spooktacular is a program that encourages elementary school-aged children to return home early from [[trick or treating]] on [[Halloween]]. Children fill out pledge cards and return them to the radio station. On Halloween night starting at 7 o'clock, 200 children win goodies bags if they are home on time when the station calls. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.cjklfm.com/ CJKL-FM] *[http://www.broadcasting-history.ca/index3.html?url=http%3A//www.broadcasting-history.ca/listings_and_histories/radio/histories.php%3Fid%3D272%26historyID%3D88 CJKL-FM history] at [[Canadian Communications Foundation]] *{{RecnetCanada|CJKL-FM}} {{Timiskaming Radio}} {{Hot Adult Contemporary Radio Stations in Ontario}} {{coord|48|04|18|N|80|01|37|W|type:landmark_region:CA|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cjkl-Fm}} [[Category:Radio stations established in 1934]] [[Category:Hot adult contemporary radio stations in Canada|Jkl]] [[Category:Radio stations in Timiskaming District|Jkl]] [[Category:Kirkland Lake]]
